availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Begins in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Forms the northern border of Kentucky from Catlettsburg, Kentucky, and terminates at the confluence with the Mississippi River near Cairo, Illinois, and Ballard County, Kentucky.
Begins in the Appalachian Mountains of West Virginia. Two branches unite near Cumberland, Maryland, continue through the District of Columbia and terminate in Chesapeake Bay. The North Branch forms the boundary between Maryland and West Virginia, as well as the boundary between Maryland and Virginia.

ab.bibl: Michael Levy, editor, "Potomac River" in Encyclopaedia Brittanica, (accessed December 21, 2019).
